title: These large-caps have ‘strong buy’ & ‘buy’ recos and an upside potential of up to 35%
summary: Here’s a message for more recent entrants to the stock market: Corrections are inevitable in every market condition. The correction which started in September 2024 may appear to be a long one to you, but there have been much longer phases of correction in the past. Yes, it is difficult to live through corrections. But remember: Real wealth is made when you ignore the noise and stay with good businesses. They will grow and become large-cap companies.

title: UltraTech Cement tightens grip on volumes, costs as pricing revival awaited
summary: Strong volume growth and falling costs helped UltraTech deliver a Q3 earnings beat, but pricing revival and integration are the next tests.

title: European shares climb on corporate updates; Puma leaps on Anta stake sale
summary: European equities climbed on Tuesday, supported by a raft of positive corporate updates that eased investors' concerns over recent ‌trade tensions, ‌while shares of Puma soared 19% after the sportswear maker sold a stake ‌to China's Anta Sports.

title: Asian Paints shares tumble 5% after Q3 PAT falls 5% YoY
summary: Asian Paints shares slid 5% after the company reported a nearly 5% year-on-year decline in Q3 consolidated net profit. Despite modest revenue growth, margin expansion and improved sequential profitability, investor sentiment weakened following the earnings announcement.

title: FIIs trimmed stakes in 10 large-cap stocks in Q3FY26. Are you affected?
Top Gainers & Losers on Jan 27: Karur Vysya Bank, MCX, Adani Enterprises, NMDC Steel, Axis Bank among top gainers
summary: The Indian stock market opened positively due to a free trade agreement with the EU and hopes of US tariff reductions on Russian oil. While key indices rose, auto stocks fell amid competition concerns. The Nifty 50 and Sensex both gained, reflecting positive investor sentiment.

title: Sensex rises 320 points, Nifty 50 ends at 25,175— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
summary: The Sensex ended at 81,857.48, rising 320 points, or 0.39%, while the Nifty 50 closed at 25,175.40, up 127 points, or 0.51%. The Nifty Midcap 150 index rose by 0.53%, while the Nifty Smallcap 250 index climbed by 0.20%.

title: Union Budget 2026: How to position your portfolio ahead of February 1 - Here's what experts advice
summary: As Union Budget 2026 approaches, investors prepare for volatility with a focus on capital expenditure and stability. Experts recommend balanced portfolios with large-cap stocks, gold, and bonds, emphasizing diversification and long-term growth themes amid market uncertainty.

title: India-EU free trade agreement: Experts recommend these 40 stocks to buy today for long term
summary: India-EU free trade agreement: These 36 stocks to buy today for the long term include Tata Motors, Precision Camshafts, Bharat Forge, Samvardhan Motherson, Rain Industries, Marksans Pharma, etc.

title: L&T Q3 preview: Profit may jump by a third, but Middle East orders in focus
summary: Markets will look at a more specific slice of order inflows -domestic private sector capex. The company said in October that it was seeing the first signs of the return of private sector capex in India, with its infra projects segment getting domestic orders worth about  ₹27,400 cr in July-September.

title: Renault bets on a French CEO and an old favourite to kick-start its India comeback
summary: Renault India's Stephane Deblaise, who took over as chief executive in September, is the only expat heading the operations of a major European carmaker in India. One of his primary tasks will be to ensure the success of mid-size SUV Duster.

title: Big Money Moves: 12 midcap stocks see higher institutional stakes in Q3 FY26
Market Wrap: Sensex adds 320 pts, Nifty above 25,100 as India-EU sign ‘mother of all deals’. All eyes on US Fed meet now
summary: India’s benchmark indices closed higher as the India-EU “mother of all deals” lifted sentiment. Sensex gained 320 points to 81,857, Nifty50 rose 127 points to 25,175. Gold surged near record highs, crude eased, and the rupee strengthened to 91.72 per dollar amid positive trade cues and global market optimism.

title: Axis Bank Q3 profit beat has investors cheering. Margin recovery next test
summary: Strong profit, deposit growth, and operational efficiency helped Axis Bank deliver strong profit for Q3, buoying investor sentiment. But, in a concern, net interest margin has remained under pressure.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Jan 27: Karur Vysya Bank, MCX, Adani Enterprises, NMDC Steel, Axis Bank among top gainers
summary: The Indian stock market opened positively due to a free trade agreement with the EU and hopes of US tariff reductions on Russian oil. While key indices rose, auto stocks fell amid competition concerns. The Nifty 50 and Sensex both gained, reflecting positive investor sentiment.

title: Gainers & Losers: Adani Enterprises among 7 stocks that moved most on Tuesday. Here’s why
summary: Indian markets ended higher as buying in financials, IT and metals offset weakness in auto and FMCG stocks. Adani Enterprises, Axis Bank, BPCL and Apex Frozen Foods gained, while Asian Paints, auto stocks and Sula Vineyards declined.

title: Mahindra shares lose Rs 18,000 crore: Is India-EU trade deal really bad for top SUV seller?
summary: Mahindra & Mahindra shares fell over 4%, erasing Rs 18,000 crore in value, as investors worried about tariff cuts for European cars under the India-EU trade deal. But analysts say the calibrated quota, mass-market exclusions, and phased EV access limit the competitive threat to Mahindra’s core SUV business.

title: Vedanta to sell 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc via OFS
summary: Vedanta will sell up to 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc via an OFS, cashing in on the subsidiary’s sharp rally. HZL shares have jumped 66% in six months amid soaring metal and silver prices, pushing its valuation to Rs 3.2 lakh crore and prompting Vedanta to monetise part of its holding.

title: India-EU ‘mother of all deals’ explained for stock market investors: The good, the bad and the ugly
summary: India has signed a landmark free trade agreement with the European Union, dubbed the “mother of all deals” by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, sparking a mixed market reaction. Textile stocks jumped up to 12% on export optimism, while automakers fell over 4% on fears of stiffer competition.

title: Budget 2026 may offer incentives for the struggling export sector: Nuvama Group's Senior VP for Research
summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, Nuvama Group's Senior VP Sandeep Raina suggests potential incentives for the struggling export sector and rural economy. With a pause in fiscal consolidation, the budget may signal a shift towards growth amidst global economic challenges.&nbsp;

title: Budget expected to take infrastructure-led growth to the next level, says YCH India's Country General Manager
summary: As India gears up for Budget 2026, YCH India's Country General Manager, Jossy Sebastian, shares insights on how strategic investments in logistics infrastructure can enhance competitiveness and create jobs, making a pivotal difference for manufacturing and exports.

title: US Fed meeting: Will Powell & Co cut rates this week? Here's what to expect
summary: The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) is set to meet to decide whether to lower the federal funds rate from its current 3.5%–3.75% range.

title: Budget 2026: How could LTCG tax rationalisation impact Indian stock market sentiment?
summary: As the Union Budget 2026 approaches, investors are buzzing about potential cuts to the Long-Term Capital Gains (LTCG) tax. Experts believe that easing taxes could enhance post-tax returns and attract more market participants.

title: Budget 2026: Capex can cross  ₹12 trillion; minor income tax benefits possible, says Sunny Agrawal of SBI Securities
summary: Over the last few years, the importance of the Union Budget as the only window for reform measures has reduced significantly, and reform measures have become round the clock process, says Sunny Agrawal, Head of Fundamental Research at SBI Securities.

title: India-EU trade deal done. FIIs now await ‘Father of all deals’ with the US, say experts
summary: The India-EU free trade agreement aims to strengthen ties but analysts emphasize the need for a successful US-India deal to attract foreign investments. Ongoing concerns about FII sentiment and rupee depreciation could impact market dynamics in the near future.

title: Hindustan Zinc OFS: Vedanta board approves 1.59% stake sale in metal company amid sharp rally. Check details
summary: Vedanta announced its Committee of Directors approved the sale of up to 6.7 crore equity shares of Hindustan Zinc, representing a 1.59% stake, via an offer-for-sale route, adhering to regulations set by the Securities and Exchange Board of India.

title: Blinkit launches RuPay powered NCMC Bharat Yatra Card
summary: Blinkit’s NCMC Bharat Yatra Card supports instant UPI top ups and eliminates the need for city specific transport cards

title: Five years after the GameStop mania, retail investors have become a force Wall Street can’t ignore
summary: "Retail investors are difference-makers. They can move markets with size and conviction," said Tom Lee, head of research at Fundstrat.
